translated: The Blessed One was dwelling in ≈örƒÅvastƒ´, in Jeta's Grove, in AnƒÅthapi·πá·∏çada's park, together with a great assembly of monks and a multitude of bodhisattvas.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' rgyal ba'i blo gros la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' rgyal ba'i blo gros la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Jayamati:

original: rgyal ba'i blo gros /üîΩrigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i blo gros / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Jayamati,

original: rigs kyi bu mo bsod nams 'dod pas de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo bsod nams 'dod pas de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod par bya'o //
translated: sons or daughters of good family who desire merit should make offerings to the TathƒÅgata.

original: shes rab 'dod pas thos pa la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab 'dod pas thos pa la brtson par bya'o //
translated: Those who desire wisdom should strive to listen.

original: mtho ris 'dod pas tshul khrims bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtho ris 'dod pas tshul khrims bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: Those who desire heaven should guard morality.

original: longs spyod 'dod pas gtong ba spel bar bya'o //
analyzed: longs spyod 'dod pas gtong ba spel bar bya'o //
translated: Those who desire wealth should increase their generosity.

original: gzugs bzang ba 'dod pas bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs bzang ba 'dod pas bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Those who desire a good physical form should cultivate patience.

original: spobs pa 'dod pas bla ma la gus par bya'o //
analyzed: spobs pa 'dod pas bla ma la gus par bya'o //
translated: Those who desire eloquence should respect their superiors.

original: gzungs 'dod pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal med par bya'o //
analyzed: gzungs 'dod pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal med par bya'o //
translated: Those who desire retention should be free of pride.

original: ye shes 'dod pas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes 'dod pas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la gnas par bya'o //
translated: Those who desire wisdom should abide in proper mental attention.

original: thar pa 'dod pas sdig pa thams cad spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pas sdig pa thams cad spang bar bya'o //
translated: Those who desire liberation should abandon all evil.

original: sems can thams cad bde bar bya bar 'dod pas byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bde bar bya bar 'dod pas byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Those who desire to bring happiness to all beings should generate the mind of awakening.

original: skad snyan pa 'dod pas bden par smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: skad snyan pa 'dod pas bden par smra bar bya'o //
translated: Those who desire a sweet voice should speak truthfully.

original: yon tan @397b 'dod pas rab tu dben pa la dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan @397b 'dod pas rab tu dben pa la dga' bar bya'o //
translated: Those who desire good qualities should delight in solitude.

original: chos 'dod pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: chos 'dod pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsten par bya'o //
translated: Those who desire the Dharma should rely on spiritual friends.

original: zhi gnas 'dod pas 'du 'dzi med pa mang du bya'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas 'dod pas 'du 'dzi med pa mang du bya'o //
translated: Those who wish for ≈õamatha should cultivate solitude.

original: lhag mthong 'dod pas chos stong par so sor brtag pa mang du bya'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong 'dod pas chos stong par so sor brtag pa mang du bya'o //
translated: Those who wish for vipa≈õyanƒÅ should cultivate the discernment of phenomena as empty.

original: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten 'dod pas byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten 'dod pas byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Those who wish for the world of BrahmƒÅ should cultivate love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: lha dang / mi'i longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa 'dod pas dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs te gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: lha dang / mi'i longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa 'dod pas dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs te gnas par bya'o //
translated: Those who wish for the perfect enjoyments of gods and humans should take up and maintain the path of the ten virtues.

original: yongs su mya ngan 'da' bar 'dod pas stong pa'i chos la mngon par dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan 'da' bar 'dod pas stong pa'i chos la mngon par dga' bar bya'o //
translated: Those who wish for complete nirvƒÅ·πáa should delight in the teachings on emptiness.

original: yon tan thams cad thob par 'dod pas dkon mchog gsum la mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad thob par 'dod pas dkon mchog gsum la mchod par bya'o //
translated: Those who wish to attain all good qualities should make offerings to the Three Jewels.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Blessed One having said that,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rgyal ba'i blo gros dang / thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rangs te /

translated: the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva Jayamati, the entire retinue, and the world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas rejoiced.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
translated: the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva Jayamati, the entire retinue, and the world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas rejoiced and praised the Blessed One‚Äôs words.
